title: s3: server side copy should use S3 multipart when copying objects over 5GB
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Server-side copy of an object >5GB fails with status "400", `InvalidRequest: The specified copy source is larger than the maximum allowable size for a copy source: 5368709120.`.

I thought rclone switches to S3 multipart, using Upload Part - Copy https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/mpUploadUploadPartCopy.html, when objects are larger than 5GB? Maybe that's only done when using `sync`?

Also nice if `rclone mv` worked the same way with >5GB objects.

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

v1.42

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

macos high sierra

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

AWS S3

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone copy -vv --dump headers s3:mahbucke/6G-rename2-s3compatible-v2 s3:mahbucke/bigfiles/6G
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

